Score.Description: Can understand the basic concepts of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division, but calculations are slow and error-prone, and have not yet mastered the calculation of fractions and decimals.
Able to independently complete the four basic arithmetic operations, understand fractions and decimals, and begin to try to solve simple one-step equations.
Proficient in the four arithmetic operations, fraction and decimal operations, able to solve simple one-step equations and perform basic percentage calculations.
Perform complex four arithmetic operations quickly and accurately, and can solve more complex fractional decimal problems and linear equations of one variable.
Accurately and quickly handle advanced math operations and problems, including multi-step equation solving and difficult percentage calculations.
Initial understanding of mathematical concepts, difficulty in independent thinking and application of abstract concepts.
Ability to recognize simple mathematical patterns and relationships, but limited in higher level abstract thinking.
Able to understand and use mathematical concepts to solve problems, with a certain level of abstract thinking.
Ability to naturally use abstract thinking to solve more complex mathematical problems.
Has a deep understanding at an abstract level and the ability to creatively solve difficult mathematical problems.
Understands basic logical sequences, but needs assistance with logical reasoning to solve problems.
Able to perform simple logical deductions, but may make mistakes in complex logical chains.
Proficiently use logical reasoning to solve daily logic problems and simple mathematical problems.
Master good logical reasoning skills and be able to deal with more complex logical and mathematical problems.
Has excellent logical reasoning ability and can independently solve difficult logical and mathematical problems.
Can recognize very basic similarities, but has difficulty making independent analogical associations.
Ability to solve simple problems through intuitive comparisons, with limited analogies.
Ability to effectively use analogies and associations to apply known concepts to solve new problems.
Able to use analogies and associations flexibly to solve problems of medium difficulty.
Highly developed ability of analogy and association, able to effectively compare and apply complex concepts.
Able to understand basic spatial concepts, but need the support of concrete objects in spatial imagination.
Ability to imagine space to a limited extent and handle simple spatial problems.
Ability to conceive of three-dimensional space and solve basic spatial geometry problems.
Ability to imagine and manipulate complex spatial shapes and objects with relative accuracy.
Has a high level of spatial imagination and can solve difficult spatial problems.
